intro: Pilosella pseudoblyttii, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Pilosella pseudoblyttii is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
